newsitem.title: JAPAN: Saks says still interested in Barney's.
newsitem.headline: Saks says still interested in Barney's.

text.p: U.S.-based Saks Holdings Inc said on Wednesday it was still interested in financially troubled Barney's Inc, even though it had decided not to bid for the posh retailer after having problems determining its true value.
"We still have an interest in the company," said Philip Miller, chairman and chief executive officer of Saks Holdings' retailing unit Saks Fifth Avenue.

"The reason why we did not make a bid is because we were having a problem understanding what the true value of the business is currently, with the recent sell-off of 17th street (Barney's original store in Manhattan) and some of their satellite stores," he said.
Miller was in Tokyo to participate in a fashion seminar.
Earlier this month, Saks issued a statement saying it had decided not to bid for high-class retailer Barney's Inc as it could no longer justify its previous offer valued at about $290 million.
Miller did not give any earnings forecasts for Saks for the second quarter or for the 1997 business year.
In May, Saks Holdings reported first quarter net income of $9.3 million.
